intro: Richardia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian richardia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
